1.description:
This state tracks the distance between the player and the AI vehicle.
If the distance is above a certain value, it first displays a message and starts a countdown.
If the countdown is over, a fail end screen is triggered
1.name: distanceFail

16.description:
This scenario sets up the scenario:
- Loads the level
- Spawns the vehicles
- Blacklists some actions
16.name: SimpleScenarioSetup

31.description:
This state resets the scenario:
- Vehicles are reset and moved to their starting positions
- AI is disabled
31.name: SimpleResetVehicle

message.value: If you are seeing this, something wrong happened and the scenario couldn't start :( \n Please report this to the nearest BeamNG developer!

40.description: This end screen shows if the player gets too far from the AI vehicle
40.name: endScreen - Distance Fail

51.commentText: Start final countdown only if AI is nearly stop and player in range

88.description: This end screen shows up if the player wins
88.name: endScreen - Success

104.description:
This state takes care of the starting screen:
- Freezes the vehicles
- Plays the camera animation
- Shows the start UI
- Plays the start countdown
104.name: SimpleStartScreen

120.description: This is the description for graph States
120.name: States

122.description:
This state group contains the states that takes care of the main gameplay:
- Main activity with the win conditions
- A state that tracks the damage, and triggers the damage fail end screen
- A state that tracks the distance and triggers the distance fail end screen
122.name: ActivityGroup
